section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The integrated universal remote control in the interior mirror can operate remote-controlled systems such as garage door openers, alarm systems or locking systems.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The integrated universal remote control replaces up to three different hand-held transmitters. To operate the remote control, the buttons on the interior mirror must be programmed with the desired functions.
Before selling the vehicle, delete the stored functions for the sake of security.
If possible, do not install the antenna of the remote-controlled system near metal objects to ensure the best possible operation.

overview.overview-text: Keep the travel paths of remote-controlled systems unobstructed

warning.paragraph: The operation of remote-controlled systems with the integrated universal remote control, such as the garage door, may result in injury, for example, body parts becoming jammed in a garage door. There is a risk of injury or risk of damage to property. Make sure that the travel path of the respective system is clear during programming and operation. Also follow the safety information for the hand-held transmitter.

section.title: Compatibility
section.paragraph: The integrated universal remote control does not support frequency range 27 MHz to 40 MHz.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: If this icon is printed on the packaging or in the operating instructions of the remote-controlled system, the system is generally compatible with the integrated universal remote control.
A list of compatible hand-held transmitters is available on the Internet: www.homelink.com

item.paragraph: An authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
www.homelink.com on the Internet.

section.paragraph: HomeLink is a registered trademark of Gentex Corporation.
An authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop will be glad to answer additional questions.

section.title: Control elements on the interior mirror

item.paragraph: Buttons, arrow 1.
LED, arrow 2.
Hand-held transmitter of the remote-controlled system, arrow 3.

section.title: Programming the integrated universal remote control
Functional requirement
section.paragraph: The battery of the hand-held transmitter must be fully charged at the time of programming to ensure an optimal range of the integrated universal remote control.

action-step.paragraph: Park the vehicle within range of the remote-controlled system.
Turn on standby state.
Select desired button on the interior mirror:

item.paragraph: Program available button:
Press the button.
Program already assigned button:
Press and hold the button for approx. 20 seconds.

action-step.paragraph: The LED on the interior mirror will slowly begin flashing orange.
Hold the hand-held transmitter for the remote-controlled system approx. 2.5 to 30 cm2.5 to 30 cm, 1 to 12 in1 to 12 in/2.5 to 30 cm away from the buttons on the interior mirror.
The required distance depends on the hand-held transmitter.
Press and hold the button on the hand-held transmitter.
Canada: if programming with the hand-held transmitter was interrupted, hold down the interior mirror button and repeatedly press and release the hand-held transmitter button for 2 seconds.
The LED can illuminate in different ways:

item.paragraph: The LED lights up green: programming completed.
Release button.
The LED flashes green rapidly: the hand-held transmitter was detected but programming is not complete.
Press and hold the button on the interior mirror for approx. 2 seconds. Perform this procedure three times.
If the integrated universal remote control remains nonoperational, continue with the special features for rolling code radio systems.
LED does not illuminate green after 60 seconds: programming not completed.
Repeat steps 3 to 5.

section.title: Special feature of the rolling code wireless system
section.paragraph: For systems with a rolling code radio system, the integrated universal remote control and the system also have to be synchronized.
Refer to information on synchronization in the operating instructions of the remote-controlled system.

action-step.paragraph: Program the desired button on the interior mirror.
Locate and press the synchronizing button on the remote-controlled system, such as on the garage door.
You have approx. 30 seconds for the next step.
Synchronizing is easier with the aid of a second person.
Press and hold the programmed button on the interior mirror for approx. 3 seconds.
If necessary, repeat this step up to three times in order to end synchronization. Once synchronization is complete, the programmed function will be carried out.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: After programming, the remote-controlled system can be operated with the button on the interior mirror.
Press and hold the desired button of the remote-controlled system within range until the function is triggered.
The LED on the interior mirror is continuously illuminated green during the transmission of the radio signal.

section.title: Deleting a button assignment
section.paragraph: The button assignment cannot be deleted individually.
Press and hold the two outer buttons on the interior mirror simultaneously for approximately 10 seconds until the LED flashes green rapidly.
All stored button assignments will be deleted.

section.title: Glare shield
section.paragraph: Fold the sun visor down or up.

action-step.paragraph: Fold the sun visor down.
Detach it from the holder and swing it toward the side window.
Shift it back to the desired position.

section.title: Folding the sun visor in
section.paragraph: Proceed in the reverse order to close the sun visor.

section.title: Vanity mirror
section.paragraph: A vanity mirror is located in the sun visor behind a cover.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The socket can be used for electronic devices when the standby or drive-ready state is switched on.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The total load of all sockets must not exceed 140 watts at 12 volts.
Do not damage the socket by using unsuitable connectors.

overview.overview-text: Keep the airbag unfolding area clear

warning.paragraph: Devices and cables in the unfolding area of the airbags, such as portable navigation devices, can hinder the unfolding of the airbag or be thrown around in the car's interior during unfolding. There is a risk of injury. Make sure that devices and cables are not in the airbag's area of unfolding.

overview.overview-text: Do not connect battery chargers to the sockets in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: Battery chargers that charge the vehicle battery via sockets or cigarette lighters in the vehicle may overload or damage the 12 V electrical system. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Only connect battery chargers for the vehicle battery to the jump-start terminals in the engine compartment.

overview.overview-text: Do not connect battery chargers to the sockets in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: Battery chargers that charge the vehicle battery via sockets or cigarette lighters in the vehicle may overload or damage the 12 V electrical system. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. In the case of a discharged vehicle battery, contact an authorized service center or other qualified service center or repair shop.

overview.overview-text: Insert the cover after use again

warning.paragraph: If metal objects fall into the socket, they can cause a short circuit. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Insert the cigarette lighter or socket cover again after using the socket.

Connected devices (mobile phones, etc.) may discharge the battery. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Disconnect all electronic device connectors (mobile phones, etc.) when exiting the vehicle.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A socket is located between the smartphone tray and the cup holders. Detach the cover.

action-step.paragraph: Press on the cover.
A socket is located between the cup holders. Detach the cover.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A socket is located on the right side in the cargo area. Unfold the cover.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Follow the information regarding the connection of mobile devices to the USB port in the section on USB connections.
Additional information:
USB connections.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A USB port is located in the center armrest.

item.paragraph: USB port Type C.
For charging mobile devices.
With navigation system: for data transfer.
Charge current: max. 3 A.

overview.overview-text: Keep the movement area of the cover unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Objects in the storage compartment, e.g., large USB connectors, may block or damage the cover when it is being opened or closed. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Make sure that the area of movement of the cover is clear while opening and closing it.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Two USB ports are located in the center console.

item.paragraph: USB port Type C.
For charging mobile devices and for data transfer.
Charge current: max. 3 A.

overview.overview-text: Keep the movement area of the cover unobstructed

warning.paragraph: Objects in the storage compartment, e.g., large USB connectors, may block or damage the cover when it is being opened or closed. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Make sure that the area of movement of the cover is clear while opening and closing it.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A USB port is located in the center console.

item.paragraph: USB port Type A.
For charging mobile devices and for data transfer.
Charge current: max. 1.5 A.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: USB ports and mounts for attaching special accessories, e.g., universal holders for tablets or clothes hangers, are located on the backrests of the front seats.
Properties of the USB ports:

item.paragraph: USB port Type C.
For charging mobile devices.
Charge current: maximum 3 A / 45 W per seat.

section.paragraph: Further information is available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The fixtures are located behind the marked covers.

action-step.paragraph: Slide the cover down.
Mount the optional accessories, refer to Assembly Instructions.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The wireless charging tray allows wireless charging of mobile phones and other mobile devices certified according to the Qi standard.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Quick charging functions are supported depending on the mobile device.
The integrated fan permits cooling of the device to be charged.
When inserting the device to be charged, ensure that there are no objects between the device to be charged and the wireless charging tray.
The charging process is shown by the charge indicator on the control display.

overview.overview-text: Observe when charging a device with Qi standard

warning.paragraph: When charging a device that meets the Qi standard in the wireless charging tray, any metal objects located between the device and the tray can become very hot. Placing storage devices or electronic cards, such as chip cards, cards with magnetic strips or cards for signal transmission, between the device and the tray may impair the card function. There is a risk of injury and risk of damage to property. When charging mobile devices, make sure there are no objects between the device and the tray.

item.paragraph: The device to be charged must be certified according to the Qi standard. For more information, contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or visit www.bmw.com/bluetooth.
Standby state is switched on.
Charging function is turned on.
The mobile phone cannot exceed a maximum size of approx. 170 x 85 x 18 mm170 x 85 x 18 mm, 6.69 x 3.34 x 0.7 in6.69 x 3.34 x 0.7 in/170 x 85 x 18 mm.
Use only protective sleeves and covers up to a maximum thickness of 2 mm2 mm, 0.07 in0.07 in/2 mm; otherwise, the charging function may be impaired.
The rubber mat is located in the storage compartment.
The mobile phone to be charged is located in the center of the tray. The mobile phone display is pointing upwards.

section.title: Inserting the mobile phone
section.paragraph: Place the mobile phone centered in the tray with the display facing up.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: A warning can be given if a Qi-certified mobile phone was forgotten in the wireless charging tray when leaving the vehicle.
The forgotten warning is displayed in the instrument cluster.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The charge current may be reduced or the charging process may be temporarily interrupted in the following situations:

item.paragraph: Due to excessive temperatures on the surface of the tray and mobile phone.
If there are objects between the mobile phone and the wireless charging tray.
By settings on the mobile phone, for instance for charging. Follow the relevant instructions on the control display and in the instructions for the mobile phone, if applicable.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The interior camera can be used to record the vehicle interior.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The interior camera can provide the following functions:

item.paragraph: Snapshot.
Photos can be taken, saved, and displayed.
Remote Inside View.
The vehicle interior can be recorded with a BMW app.
Anti-theft recorder.
If the alarm system is triggered, the vehicle interior is automatically recorded. The recording can be shown using the BMW app.

section.title: Data protection
section.paragraph: The permissibility of recording and using recordings is contingent upon the statutory regulations of the country in which the system is to be used. The user is responsible for the use of the system and compliance with respective applicable regulations.

The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends confirming there are no statutory or regulatory constraints on use of the system in your state or country prior to the initial use. In addition, the laws with respect to use of the system should be verified in regular intervals, especially when borders are frequently crossed.
Other users and occupants of the vehicle must be informed about the system. In addition, information about the system is required when handing off the vehicle.

section.title: Data transfer and data storage
section.paragraph: The data transfer and data storage of the media recordings depends on the recording function.
Snapshot:

item.paragraph: Data transfer to a mobile device, connection to the vehicle via WLAN.
Data is stored in the vehicle and assigned to the BMW ID or a driver profile.

section.paragraph: Remote Inside View:

item.paragraph: Data transfer with the BMW app to a mobile device, connection with the ConnectedDrive account.
Data is stored in the BMW app and after the data transfer in the mobile device.

section.paragraph: Anti-theft recorder:

item.paragraph: Data transfer with the BMW app to a mobile device, connection with the ConnectedDrive account.
Data is stored in the vehicle and after the data transfer in the mobile device.

section.paragraph: More information on the scope and content of data processing is available on the Internet in the ConnectedDrive privacy notices/service descriptions.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: Snapshot:

item.paragraph: Privacy Policy accepted.
Data protection.
The camera is activated.

section.paragraph: To transfer recordings to mobile devices:

item.paragraph: Data transfer is activated.
Mobile device is connected to the vehicle via WLAN.

section.paragraph: Remote Inside View/Anti-theft recorder:

item.paragraph: Privacy Policy accepted.
BMW app is installed on the mobile device.
BMW app is linked with the ConnectedDrive account.
Vehicle is parked and locked.
Anti-theft recorder: equipped with alarm system.

section.paragraph: Ensure that the faces of occupants are visible and are not partially or completely covered, for instance by face masks.

section.title: Overview
section.paragraph: The interior camera is located on the headliner.

section.title: Activating/deactivating interior camera
section.paragraph: Prior to the first use of the interior camera, the recording function and, if necessary, data transfer must be activated. To do this, confirm the query on the control display.
Follow applicable legal regulations.
The recording function or data transfer can be deactivated or activated.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

entry.paragraph: Shortly after triggering, a photo will be taken.
When the system detects a smile, a picture will be taken.
After the timer has expired, a photo will be taken.
Shortly after triggering, a series of pictures will be taken.

section.title: Take picture

action-step.paragraph: Select desired recording mode.
Triggering a photo.

section.paragraph: Depending on the selected recording mode, the photo is taken shortly after triggering, when a smile is recognized, or if the timer has elapsed.
For burst shots, the series of pictures will be displayed as a preview.

section.title: Displaying and managing recordings
section.paragraph: Saved recordings can be displayed, transferred and deleted in the vehicle.
In some national-market versions, the recordings are only shown on the control display for up to approx. 3 km/h3 km/h, approx. 2 mph2 mph/3 km/h for your own safety.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired recording.
Select the desired setting.

section.paragraph: Scan the QR code shown in the display to transfer recordings to a mobile device. The recording is transferred when the pop-up on the mobile device is opened. The mobile device must be connected to the vehicle via WLAN.

section.title: Settings

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.paragraph: An individual gesture can be assigned for recordings with the interior camera.

section.title: Remote Inside View
section.paragraph: Recordings from the vehicle interior can be displayed on a mobile device with the BMW app to check the vehicle interior, e.g., for forgotten objects.

section.title: Anti-theft recorder
section.paragraph: If the alarm system is triggered, the vehicle interior is automatically recorded using the interior camera. The BMW app notifies you of the recording. The recording can be shown on a mobile device.

section.title: Occupying the seats
section.paragraph: The interior camera is also used for the detection of occupied seats.

When all doors are closed, the interior camera switches on automatically on a regular basis. The system analyzes the vehicle interior to detect occupied seats. No media recordings are made in the process. Two infrared light sources next to the camera lens light up while the interior camera is active. Depending on the lighting conditions, the infrared light sources may be visible.
